dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5842 IH: Revamping the Education of our Veterans to Align Manufacturing through Partnerships with Community Colleges Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Israel introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to establish a competitive grant program for community colleges to train veterans for local jobs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Revamping the Education of our Veterans to Align Manufacturing through Partnerships with Community Colleges Act of 2014 or REVAMP with Community Colleges Act of 2014.

paragraph.text: In October 2014, the unemployment rate for veterans who had returned from Iraq and Afghanistan was 7.2 percent, a rate above the national average. Unemployment among returning female veterans was even higher, and also was above the national average.
Such veterans have benefits to use under chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code.
Manufacturing companies have approximately 285,000 vacancies they are struggling to fill.

section.header: Grant program to train veterans for local jobs

subsection.text: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, shall establish a program to award competitive grants to eligible community colleges (as described in subsection (b)) to train covered veterans for jobs in the local community.

In order to be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a community college shall submit an application to the Secretary that demonstrates, to the satisfaction of the Secretary, that the local community in which the community college is located has—

paragraph.text: employment opportunities that require trained workers; and
a significant population of covered veterans that might pursue the employment opportunities described in paragraph (1) if given access to necessary training.

subsection.text: A community college receiving a grant under this section shall use amounts under the grant to—

subparagraph.text: the demand for additional trained employees among local employers, including local manufacturers; and
the skills and training possessed by covered veterans seeking employment with local employers, including local manufacturers;

paragraph.text: carry out an existing, or develop and implement a new, certificate or degree program at the community college that provides training to covered veterans that addresses the demand for additional trained employees among local employers, including local manufacturers; and
facilitate the establishment of an advisory board that consists of representatives from the local business community and the employee from the Department of Veterans Affairs detailed under section 4—

subparagraph.text: to provide assistance regarding the training described in paragraph (2); and
to assist covered veterans who have successfully completed the training described in paragraph (2) in their pursuit of local employment opportunities.

section.header: Detail of Department of Veterans Affairs employee
section.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall detail an employee of the Department of Veterans Affairs to participate on the supervisory board established in section 3(c)(3).
To the maximum extent practicable, the amount of a grant under section 3 shall not exceed $2,000,000.
Not later than one year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report—

paragraph.text: evaluating the success of the program established under section 3; and
making recommendations as to whether the program should be continued, and if so, whether the program should be expanded.
The term community college has the meaning given the term junior or community college in section 312(f) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1058(f)).
The term covered veteran means a veteran receiving educational assistance under chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Labor.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 to carry out this Act.
Amounts appropriated pursuant to the authorization of appropriations under subsection (a) are authorized to remain available until expended.
